definition: The cognitive and practical activities involved in producing written text, including planning, drafting, revising, and editing

positive_examples: The writing process is recursive: writers move back and forth between planning, drafting, and revising.
Different writers have different processes; some plan extensively, others discover through drafting.
The process approach to teaching writing focuses on stages rather than just products.
Metacognition about writing process: knowing when to draft freely versus when to plan carefully.
training_hints.disambiguation: Distinct stages and cognitive activities of composition, not just the act of writing
